item.title: Judge Rules Texas Can't Cut Off Medicaid Funds To Planned Parenthood — For Now
item.description: February 22, 2017 - After Texas officials moved to block the health provider from receiving Medicaid dollars, a federal judge issued a preliminary injunction against the state, allowing the group to stay in the program.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 22, 2017 - After Texas officials moved to block the health provider from receiving Medicaid dollars, a federal judge issued a preliminary injunction against the state, allowing the group to stay in the program. http://www.npr.org/sections/thetwo-way/2017/02/22/516631590/judge-rules-texas-cant-cut-off-medicaid-funds-to-planned-parenthood-for-now

item.title: Heart Screening For Teens May Cause More Problems Than It Solves
item.description: February 22, 2017 - There's no evidence that screening adolescents with electrocardiograms prevents deaths, yet the heart tests have become widespread despite the false alarms they often cause.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 22, 2017 - There's no evidence that screening adolescents with electrocardiograms prevents deaths, yet the heart tests have become widespread despite the false alarms they often cause. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/22/516406346/heart-screening-for-teens-may-cause-more-problems-than-it-solves

item.title: GOP Considers Trimming Health Law's 10 Essential Benefits
item.description: February 22, 2017 - The woman set to run the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services told senators that maternity coverage should be optional in individual and small group plans. Other services could be cut entirely.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 22, 2017 - The woman set to run the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services told senators that maternity coverage should be optional in individual and small group plans. Other services could be cut entirely. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/22/516465156/gop-seeks-reduction-in-health-law-s-10-essential-benefits

item.title: Threat Of Obamacare Repeal Leaves Community Health Centers In Limbo
item.description: February 22, 2017 - These clinics have long provided health care to low-income patients and enjoyed expansion under the Affordable Care Act. With repeal looming, the centers' doctors worry about what's next.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 22, 2017 - These clinics have long provided health care to low-income patients and enjoyed expansion under the Affordable Care Act. With repeal looming, the centers' doctors worry about what's next. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/22/515413111/threat-of-obamacare-repeal-leaves-community-health-centers-in-limbo

item.title: Researchers Failed To Tell Testosterone Trial Patients They Were Anemic
item.description: February 21, 2017 - Low levels of iron in the blood may indicate a serious but treatable medical condition if caught early, but patients in a testosterone trial were not informed, a bioethicist finds.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 21, 2017 - Low levels of iron in the blood may indicate a serious but treatable medical condition if caught early, but patients in a testosterone trial were not informed, a bioethicist finds. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/21/516463092/researchers-failed-to-tell-testosterone-trial-patients-they-were-anemic

item.title: Does Testosterone Improve Older Men's Health? It Depends
item.description: February 21, 2017 - Several studies out this week show mixed results for testosterone replacement. It appears to protect bone density and strength and prevent anemia, but there is no effect on memory and cognition.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 21, 2017 - Several studies out this week show mixed results for testosterone replacement. It appears to protect bone density and strength and prevent anemia, but there is no effect on memory and cognition. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/21/515456194/does-testosterone-improve-older-mens-health-it-depends

item.title: Health Insurance Woes Add To The Risky Business Of Farming
item.description: February 21, 2017 - There are many challenges to farming: It's often grueling work that relies on unpredictable factors such as weather and global market prices. But one aspect that's often ignored: health care costs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 21, 2017 - There are many challenges to farming: It's often grueling work that relies on unpredictable factors such as weather and global market prices. But one aspect that's often ignored: health care costs. http://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2017/02/21/515196225/health-insurance-woes-add-to-the-risky-business-of-farming

item.title: As They Dig Deeper Into Parenting, Fathers Seek Community, Support
item.description: February 21, 2017 - More dads are getting involved with parenting, but the resources to help them are much slimmer than those available for moms.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 21, 2017 - More dads are getting involved with parenting, but the resources to help them are much slimmer than those available for moms. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/21/515414558/as-they-dig-deeper-into-parenting-fathers-seek-community-support

item.title: The Next Pandemic Could Be Dripping On Your Head
item.description: February 21, 2017 - Bats, birds and tourists love a good cave. And so do viruses. Scientists say this mixture could trigger a deadly outbreak.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 21, 2017 - Bats, birds and tourists love a good cave. And so do viruses. Scientists say this mixture could trigger a deadly outbreak. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/02/21/508060742/the-next-pandemic-could-be-dripping-on-your-head

item.title: Can Poetry Keep You Young? Science Is Still Out, But The Heart Says Yes
item.description: February 20, 2017 - Scientific evidence showing health benefits from engaging in the arts is still weak. But Los Angeles students in their 80s say their poetry class gives them joy, solace, community and a voice.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 20, 2017 - Scientific evidence showing health benefits from engaging in the arts is still weak. But Los Angeles students in their 80s say their poetry class gives them joy, solace, community and a voice. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/20/514558968/can-poetry-keep-you-young-science-is-still-out-but-the-heart-says-yes

item.title: Got Back Pain? Try Yoga Or Massage Before Reaching For The Pills
item.description: February 20, 2017 - New guidelines encourage doctors to tell patients to try non-drug therapies for acute lower back pain first.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 20, 2017 - New guidelines encourage doctors to tell patients to try non-drug therapies for acute lower back pain first. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/20/515675259/got-back-pain-try-yoga-or-massage-before-reaching-for-the-pills

item.title: A Foster Parent For Terminally Ill Children
item.description: February 19, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks to Los Angeles foster parent Mohamed Bzeek. He takes care of terminally ill foster children and tends full-time to their medical needs.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 19, 2017 - NPR's Lulu Garcia-Navarro talks to Los Angeles foster parent Mohamed Bzeek. He takes care of terminally ill foster children and tends full-time to their medical needs. http://www.npr.org/2017/02/19/516064735/a-foster-parent-for-terminally-ill-children

item.title: Top Items On This 12-Year-Old's Wish List: 'A Leg, A Bicycle'
item.description: February 19, 2017 - The one-legged orphan in Liberia had figured out how to use a crutch as an improvised prosthetic leg. But he wanted the real deal.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 19, 2017 - The one-legged orphan in Liberia had figured out how to use a crutch as an improvised prosthetic leg. But he wanted the real deal. http://www.npr.org/sections/goatsandsoda/2017/02/19/514534638/top-items-on-this-12-year-olds-wish-list-a-leg-a-bicycle

item.title: Can Changing When And What We Eat Help Outwit Disease?
item.description: February 19, 2017 - I'm fasting intermittently as part of a research study, to see if changing my gut microbiome affects my multiple sclerosis. But maybe living on Peanut Chews isn't the best strategy.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 19, 2017 - I'm fasting intermittently as part of a research study, to see if changing my gut microbiome affects my multiple sclerosis. But maybe living on Peanut Chews isn't the best strategy. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/19/514179856/can-changing-when-and-what-we-eat-help-outwit-disease

item.title: GOP Leaders Urge Return To 'High-Risk Insurance Pools' That Critics Call Costly
item.description: February 18, 2017 - Some Republicans in Congress say they could partly fix the federal health law by again separating people who buy insurance into two categories — sick and healthy. Critics say it won't save money.
item.itunes:author: podcasts@npr.org (NPR Podcasts)
item.itunes:summary: February 18, 2017 - Some Republicans in Congress say they could partly fix the federal health law by again separating people who buy insurance into two categories — sick and healthy. Critics say it won't save money. http://www.npr.org/sections/health-shots/2017/02/18/514991567/gop-leaders-urge-return-to-high-risk-insurance-pools-that-critics-call-costly
